root.name: Theme Park
root.description: GameplayWorld map screen showing different plots of land available for purchase. Like most management games, Theme Park starts you off with a plot of land that you have to develop. The player can build many things found commonly at an amusement park, such as roller coasters and Ferris wheels, all of which can attract more customers. Players are able to set prices, hire new staff and generally maintain the plot. The aim of the game is to make the theme park as valuable as possible so that it can be sold and a new plot can be bought some where else in the world. The player then starts to make a new theme park and the process is repeated.The DOS CD version featured Full Motion Videos of some of the rides.
